claim.body: roof for harvesting and recycling rain water, comprising: a water filtration system disposed to mimic a natural wetland ecosystem, said water filtration system lined with at least one water-impervious layer of material disposed on a top surface of a roof of a building, thereby defining a wetland filtration area; and a water containment area located directly beneath said water filtration system and disposed within a footprint of the building to collect water from the water filtration system to be made available for use; a means for pumping water from said water containment area up to and into said wetland filtration area; and a water re-entry pipe for moving water from said wetland filtration area to said water containment area.
claim.claim-text: 1. A self sustaining roof for harvesting and recycling rain water, comprising: a water filtration system disposed to mimic a natural wetland ecosystem, said water filtration system lined with at least one water-impervious layer of material disposed on a top surface of a roof of a building, thereby defining a wetland filtration area; and a water containment area located directly beneath said water filtration system and disposed within a footprint of the building to collect water from the water filtration system to be made available for use; a means for pumping water from said water containment area up to and into said wetland filtration area; and a water re-entry pipe for moving water from said wetland filtration area to said water containment area.

claim.body: at least one water-impermeable layer placed beneath said water containment area.
claim.claim-text: 2. The self-sustaining roof of claim 1 , further comprising at least one water-impermeable layer placed beneath said water containment area.

claim.body: the building comprises at least one wall defining a perimeter of said footprint, and further wherein said water-impermeable layer beneath said water containment area extends at least waist high up the perimeter-defining wall of the building.
claim.claim-text: 3. The self-sustaining roof of claim 2 , wherein the building comprises at least one wall defining a perimeter of said footprint, and further wherein said water-impermeable layer beneath said water containment area extends at least waist high up the perimeter-defining wall of the building.

claim.body: at least one water-pervious layer placed between said wetland filtration area and said water containment area.
claim.claim-text: 4. The self-sustaining roof of claim 1 , further comprising at least one water-pervious layer placed between said wetland filtration area and said water containment area.

5. A vegetated roof system for harvesting and recycling rain water, comprising: a layer comprising a first area comprising vegetation and a second area comprising a wetland filtration system, said layer disposed on a top surface of a roof of a building to harvest at least a portion of rain water that impinges on said layer;

claim.body: a biological filter media located between said layer of vegetation and said water-pervious fabric.
claim.claim-text: 6. The vegetated roof system of claim 5 , further comprising a biological filter media located between said layer of vegetation and said water-pervious fabric.

claim.body: wetland filtration system comprises bio-balls.
claim.claim-text: 7. The vegetated roof system of claim 6 , wherein said wetland filtration system comprises bio-balls.

claim.body: wetland filtration system further comprises gravel.
claim.claim-text: 8. The vegetated roof system of claim 6 , wherein said wetland filtration system further comprises gravel.

claim.body: water containment area comprises a plurality of rain tanks.
claim.claim-text: 9. The vegetated roof system of claim 5 , wherein said water containment area comprises a plurality of rain tanks.

claim.body: water containment area further comprises a gray water storage tank.
claim.claim-text: 10. The vegetated roof system of claim 5 , wherein said water containment area further comprises a gray water storage tank.

claim.body: gray water storage tank is located on a roof of a building, or one story below.
claim.claim-text: 11. The vegetated roof system of claim 10 , wherein said gray water storage tank is located on a roof of a building, or one story below.

claim.body: a second pump located in the wetlands filtration system area to pump water to the vegetation area.
claim.claim-text: 12. The vegetated roof system of claim 5 , further comprising a second pump located in the wetlands filtration system area to pump water to the vegetation area.

claim.body: an overflow system.
claim.claim-text: 13. The vegetated roof system of claim 5 , further comprising an overflow system.

claim.body: overflow system connects with local storm water management or to a separate harvesting basin on the ground.
claim.claim-text: 14. The vegetated roof system of claim 13 , wherein said overflow system connects with local storm water management or to a separate harvesting basin on the ground.

claim.body: harvesting basin is arranged to contain water that could be used at ground level.
claim.claim-text: 15. The vegetated roof system of claim 14 , wherein said harvesting basin is arranged to contain water that could be used at ground level.

claim.body: harvesting basin is arranged to be a deep ground infiltrating drain so that the water can re-enter and help recharge an aquifer.
claim.claim-text: 16. The vegetated roof system of claim 14 , wherein said harvesting basin is arranged to be a deep ground infiltrating drain so that the water can re-enter and help recharge an aquifer.

claim.body: at least one water-impervious layer placed below said water containment area.
claim.claim-text: 17. The vegetated roof system of claim 5 , further comprising at least one water-impervious layer placed below said water containment area.

claim.body: at least one water-impervious layer comprises at least one of polypropylene and EPDM material.
claim.claim-text: 18. The vegetated roof system of claim 17 , wherein said at least one water-impervious layer comprises at least one of polypropylene and EPDM material.

claim.body: at least two water-pervious fabrics, and wherein said at least one water-impermeable layer is placed between said at least two water-pervious fabrics.
claim.claim-text: 19. The vegetated roof system of claim 17 , further comprising at least two water-pervious fabrics, and wherein said at least one water-impermeable layer is placed between said at least two water-pervious fabrics.

claim.body: at least one of said at least two water-pervious fabrics comprises geo-textile fabric.
claim.claim-text: 20. The vegetated roof system of claim 19 , wherein at least one of said at least two water-pervious fabrics comprises geo-textile fabric.

claim.body: an area where there is no layer of terrestrial vegetation located above said water filtration system.
claim.claim-text: 22. The vegetated roof system of claim 21 , further comprising an area where there is no layer of terrestrial vegetation located above said water filtration system.

claim.body: water filtration system comprises at least one of gravel and bio-balls.
claim.claim-text: 23. The vegetated roof system of claim 21 , wherein said water filtration system comprises at least one of gravel and bio-balls.
